definition: "right open box" radical (Kangxi radical 22), occurring in 区, 医, 匹 etc

first of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/(used for an unspecified person or thing)/first (in a list, as a party to a contract etc)/letter "A" or roman "I" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/armor plating/shell or carapace/(of the fingers or toes) nail/bladed leather or metal armor (old)/ranking system used in the Imperial examinations (old)/civil administration unit in the baojia 保甲[bao3 jia3] system (old)/ancient Chinese compass point: 75°

sentences.chinese: 玩偶匣的弹簧昨天坏了。

sentences.english: Or some other digital black -magic box ?
sentences.chinese: 或其他一些数字黑色魔术匣？

sentences.english: Store the optional print cartridge and protector.
sentences.chinese: 储存选用的列印墨匣与护套。

sentences.english: After many experiments we succeeded in making a boxful of matches.
sentences.chinese: 多次试验后，我们终于成功地制造出一满匣的火柴。

sentences.english: Before the strike anywhere match was invented people used tinderboxes.
sentences.chinese: 在万能火柴发明之前，人们用的是火绒匣。

sentences.english: Do you know the locations of British Isles?
sentences.chinese: 你转道不列颠群岛的匣置吗？

sentences.english: The documents fed into the fax machine were scanned and came out in the return tray.
sentences.chinese: 文件放入传真机会被扫描然后送出到文件回收匣。

sentences.english: You can wingk to the stockroom to see if there's any toner cfine artridge left.
sentences.chinese: 你可以到蕴藏室看看碳粉匣有没有剩。

sentences.english: Buildings, like matchboxes, act as the overcoat of this city.
sentences.chinese: 如火柴匣一样的建筑构成她的外套。

sentences.english: Before the strike anywhere match was invented people used tinder boxes.
sentences.chinese: 在万能火柴发明之前，人们用的是火绒匣。

sentences.english: You can walk to the stockroom to see if there's any toner cartridge left.
sentences.chinese: 你可以到蕴藏室看看碳粉匣有无剩。

definition: handle or shaft (of an axe etc)/(of a flower, leaf or fruit) stem/sth that affords an advantage to an opponent/classifier for knives or blades
tube/cylinder/to encase in sth cylindrical (such as hands in sleeves etc)
a bow (weapon)/CL:張|张[zhang1]/to bend/to arch (one's back etc)
spring-loaded arrow concealed in one's sleeve
to bend the body at the waist/to bow
